page.title: 07Horticulture 1
page.content: Much of the area is devoted to orchards. The main produce is apples and pears with some soft fruit. Fontenay Orchards cover 62 acres in all. It is part of a larger co-operative enterprise, based in Kent. Two men work full-time and two women part-time. There is some P.Y.O.(pick your own), but the annual produce of more than 500 tons is sold nationwide, and to the near continent. Whitehouse Farm covers 55 acres, including woodland of oak, with recently planted conifers to provide cover for a local shoot. All produce is for the retail trade. Two men work full-time, and up to 30 work casually in the summer. The farm has its own reservoir, which provides ample water. Varieties of fruit include cox, discovery, spartan, egremont russet, and bramley apples and some pears.
